page.title: 13Home life in Charnwood 1
page.content: The retired owner of{Whitcroft}a large cottage surrounded by garden,10acres of woodland & paddock regards himself as poor,struggling on a fixed income to keep up the standard of a Country Gent. Powered tools help him to cope with the land.Two cars mean he and his wife can pursue their own interests, his being shooting and local country sporting events. The M1 separated the{Lodge}from Bardon Hall and it is now owned by a Wood Sculptor whose work is a delight. This retired gentleman and his wife love gardening growing their own fruit and vegetables.Until recently collected rain water and a bore hole in the garden was their only water supply.They like the privacy of living in the country and are interested in its conservation but they need their car to complete their lives.
